title: App Configuration Schema
description: Configuration schema for enterprise-specific settings in the Enterprise Support application. This file controls branding, contact information, feature flags, theming, and regional office details.

$version.description: Schema version for enterprise stability and migration support. Semantic versioning format (major.minor).

companyName.description: Your company's official name. Used throughout the application and in document content. Keep it concise for better readability.

appName.description: Full application name shown in the app header and iOS app. Typically includes your company name and 'Support' or similar.

appId.description: iOS bundle identifier using reverse domain notation (e.g., com.company.app). CRITICAL: Must be unique in App Store and cannot be changed after submission. Must match your Apple Developer provisioning profile.

appSubtitle.description: Optional subtitle displayed in the app header, providing context about the app's purpose.

domain.description: Your company's primary email domain (without @ symbol). Used in documentation and email references.

vpnPortal.description: Optional VPN portal address. If provided, used in VPN setup documentation. Can be a full URL or hostname.

contacts.description: Contact information for IT support and emergency services. All email addresses should be monitored mailboxes.

email.description: Primary IT helpdesk email address. This is the main contact point for support requests.

emergencyEmail.description: Optional emergency or security team email for urgent issues. Used for security incidents and critical problems.

regions.description: Array of regional office contact information. Add as many regions as your organization has offices. Leave empty if you have only one location or prefer not to list regional contacts.

region.description: Geographic region name (e.g., Americas, EMEA, Asia Pacific, or more specific like North America, Europe).

city.description: City and state/country for this office. Add '(HQ)' suffix for headquarters location.

phone.description: Phone number with country code. Format: +[country code] ([area code]) [number]. Use international format for clarity. Must contain at least 10 digits.

hours.description: Business hours with timezone. Be specific about timezone abbreviations (EST, GMT, JST, etc.) or use UTC offsets.

features.description: Feature flags to enable or disable application features. All features are disabled by default.

tagFiltering.description: Enable tag-based filtering in document lists. Allows users to filter documents by category tags.

pdfDocuments.description: Enable PDF document viewing with native viewer support.

wordDocuments.description: Enable Word document (.docx) viewing and rendering.

imageDocuments.description: Enable image document viewing (PNG, JPG, GIF, etc.).

theme.description: Theme configuration for application appearance and user customization options.

defaultTheme.description: Default theme ID applied on first load. Must match one of the theme IDs in the themes array.

enableThemeSwitcher.description: Show theme selector in the UI. Set to false to lock users to the default theme.

themes.description: Available themes for the application. At least one theme must be enabled.

id.description: Unique theme identifier used in CSS class names and storage.

name.description: Human-readable theme name shown in the theme selector.

description.description: Optional description of the theme shown in tooltips or extended UI.

enabled.description: Whether this theme is available for selection. Disabled themes are hidden from the UI.

documents.description: Available documents configuration. Each document specifies a friendly name and the path to the document file relative to the workspace root. The manifest.json file at the specified path will be loaded to retrieve document metadata.

name.description: Friendly name describing the document collection (e.g., 'IT Support Documents', 'Employee Handbook').

path.description: Path to the document manifest.json file, relative to the workspace root (e.g., 'public/documents/manifest.json').

position.description: Optional numeric position for ordering documents. Lower numbers appear first. Documents without a position value are placed after positioned documents in their natural order.
